moves.1. e4 b6: With black choosing b6 I decide to gain a good foothold in d and e.
moves.2. d4 Bb7 3. d5 Nf6 4. f3 e5 5. Bg5: Thought to give a little pressure on black's night.
moves.5... Bb4+: Black counters by placing me in check.
moves.6. c3 Bc5 7. b4 Be7 8. Bb5: Back black off then position my bishop on b5.
moves.8... Nh5: Not too bad on black's move here.  I retreat to e3.
moves.9. Be3 Bh4+: I'm in check again by the same bishop but now on h4.  It's not hard to defend this however.
moves.10. g3 Bf6 11. Nd2 a6 12. Be2 a5 13. f4: Here's the first capture which puts me up by 3!
moves.14... g6 15. Be2 Nd7 16. Qa4: Placing my queen on a4 proves to be vital for my victory!
moves.18... dxe5: Black quickly takes that point back.
moves.19. Nxe5 O-O: This move proves to aid in my victory.
moves.20. Nxd7 Re8 21. Bh6: Placing my bishop in just the right place.
moves.21... Bc8 22. bxa5: This opens the lane for my queen.
moves.22... bxa5 23. Qd4: Hoping black does not notice this and block me by placing black's bishop on f6.
moves.23... Bxd7: Black does not block me so here I go!
